definition: to cry out in alarm or surprise
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale

sentences.chinese: 她驚呼，“誰會盯孩子們的梢？

sentences.english: Snow White looked at, is nian saw immediately loudly exclaimed the child.
sentences.chinese: 白雪見狀，立即大聲驚呼這孩子是神仙下凡。

sentences.english: The four exclaimed in unison, with an awestruck look on their faces.
sentences.chinese: 那四人不約而同的大聲驚呼，臉露敬畏之色。

sentences.english: Trevor awed. “I never imagined it to be like this!”
sentences.chinese: 特雷福驚呼道，“我可真沒想到會是這樣。”

sentences.english: And your sister starts to scream.
Meeting unexpectedly a friend he hadn't seen for years, Jim voiced his surprise.
sentences.chinese: 看到一個多年未見的朋友，吉姆發出了一聲驚呼。

sentences.english: Somebody exclamations group purchase winter has come.
sentences.chinese: 有人驚呼團購冬天已至。

definition: to be amazed/to be surprised/to wonder
to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
to see with one's own eyes/very soon
